{"id":1050929391,"question_id":3045,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"9Â months","timestamp":1694875376,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"4 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/1050929391/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Minimum Right Shifts to Sort the Array","memory":"41.2 MB","code":"class Solution {\n    public int minimumRightShifts(List<Integer> nums) {\n        \n        for(int st=0; st<nums.size(); st++){\n            boolean flag = true;\n            for(int i=0; i<nums.size()-1;i++){\n                int idx = (i-st+nums.size())%nums.size();\n                int next = (i-st+1+nums.size())%nums.size();\n                \n                if(nums.get(idx)>nums.get(next)){\n                    flag=false;\n                    break;\n                }\n            }\n            \n            if(flag)\n                return st;\n            \n        }\n        \n        return -1;\n        \n    }\n}","compare_result":"","title_slug":"minimum-right-shifts-to-sort-the-array","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
